homework1

Class LocationChangingShape

  • java.lang.Object
    • homework1.Shape
      • homework1.LocationChangingShape
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Animatable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ColorAndLocationChangingShape, LocationChangingOval

    public abstract class LocationChangingShape
extends Shape
implements Animatable
    A LocationChaningShape is a Shape that can change its location using its step() method. A LocationChaningShape has a velocity property that determines the speed of location changing. Thus, a typical LocationChaningShape consists of the following set of properties: {location, color, shape, size, velocity}

    • Constructor Detail

      • LocationChangingShape

        public LocationChangingShape(java.awt.Point location,
                             java.awt.Color color)
        Effects:
        Initializes this with a a given location and color. Each of the horizontal and vertical velocities of the new object is set to a random integral value i such that -5 <= i <= 5 and i != 0

    • Method Detail

      • setVelocity

        public void setVelocity(int velocityX,
                        int velocityY)
        Modifies:
        this
        Effects:
        Sets the horizontal velocity of this to velocityX and the vertical velocity of this to velocityY.

      • step

        public void step(java.awt.Rectangle bound)
        Specified by:
        step in interface Animatable
        Modifies:
        this
        Effects:
        Let p = location v = (vx, vy) = velocity r = the bounding rectangle of this If (part of r is outside bound) or (r is within bound but adding v to p would bring part of r outside bound) { If adding v to p would move r horizontally farther away from the center of bound, vx = -vx If adding v to p would move r vertically farther away from the center of bound, vy = -vy } p = p + v
